Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RV23 (encrypted AMPs; synthetic AMPs, hu-man furin-prodomain derived peptide; UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: The peptide was found via peptide screening.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (35.14%) toOL-CATH2G: 17%. GRAVY: -0.58; Mol Wt: 2848.225; Mol formula: C136H189N38O30; Mol Ex coeff:  8530.Activity: active against E. coli (MIC 4 uM), P.aeruginosa (MIC >100 uM); S.enterica (MIC >100 uM); K.pneumoniae (MIC >100 uM); S.aureus (MIC >100 uM); B.subtilis (MIC >100 uM); S.pyogenes (MIC >100 uM); and E.faecalis (MIC >100 uM).Puzzle: Whether this fragment is cleaved in vivo remains to be confirmed.APD comment: It appears to be a highly selective peptide of interest.
Literature Information.Author: Sinha S, Harioudh MK, Dewangan RP, Ng WJ, Ghosh JK, Bhattacharjya S.2018
Literature Information.Title: Cell-Selective Pore Forming Antimicrobial Peptides of the Prodomain of Human Furin: A Conserved Aromatic/Cationic Sequence Mapping, Membrane Disruption, and Atomic-Resolution Structure and Dynamics
